message: Coxcomb Hill Rd, WASN'T EVEN TOUCHED. It is literally one of the top 5 dangerous roads to navigate under adverse weather conditions. Don't pay fines that you get when there is snow covering roads that should have been cleared. Fight it, and cite the road conditions.

500 million years ago atmospheric CO2 was some 20 times higher than present values. It dropped, then rose again some 200 million years ago to 4-5 times present levels--a period that saw the rise of giant fern forests--and then continued a slow decline until recent pre-industrial time.

I agree with your sentiment, . But it's not a sign of disrespect for publications to leave titles and honorifics out of headlines, where space is at a premium. The way most journalists handle names is to give the full name and title on first mention in the body of the article, then refer to the person by last name or their """"publicly known as"""" name after that.
